item.title: Moneta Release 1.4.3
item.description:
Release 1.4.3

Mac40 Update Release

Update 3 of JSR 354 RI 1.4 was released today.
On this date, the Apple Macintosh turned 40.
A complete list of all issues fixed by the 1.4.3 Milestone. And check the release tag 1.4.3 in the GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped with this release.

item.title: JSR 354 EG Turns 10
item.description:
10 Years JSR 354 EG Formation

10th Anniversary of JSR 354 Formation

Today the EG Formation of JSR 354 has been 10 years ago. Following the JSR Review Ballot.
To the next decades of JavaMoney.

item.title: Moneta Release 1.4.2
item.description:
Release 1.4.2

1.4 Update 2

Update Release 2 of JSR 354 RI 1.4 was released today.
The release fixed problem with the configuration and improved the monetary context, see 1.4.2 Milestone. And check the release tag 1.4.2 in the GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped with this release.

item.title: Moneta Release 1.4.1
item.description:
Release 1.4.1

Valkyrie Update Release

Update Release 1 of JSR 354 RI 1.4 was released today.
On this date, the 76th anniversary of the attempted "Operation Valkyrie" coup by Claus von Stauffenberg and his co-conspirators we dedicate this release to their courage, sacrifice and memory.
The release fixed a problem with the JPMS (Jigsaw), ensures compatibility with Java 14 and added a few minor improvements, for a complete list see 1.4.1 Milestone. And check the release tag 1.4.1 in the GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped with this release.

item.title: Maintenance Release 1
item.description:
MR 1

Maintenance Release 1

JSR 354 just passed Maintenance Review Ballot by the JCP EC. Check out the results.
Maintenance Release 1 of JSR 354 will be made available soon on jcp.org after it's already been to popular Maven repositories.
Get it e.g. via MavenCentral Repository Search for money-api-1.1.

Thanks everyone who helped with JSR 354 and the wider JavaMoney project.

item.title: Java 25th Birthday Week
item.description:
Moved by Java

Java 25th Birthday Week Release Train

Today Java turned 25. Oracle dedicated a Moved by Java anniversary page and kicked off the #MovedbyJava campaign on social media.
As JSR 354 Maintenance Leads we celebrated the 25th birthday of Java and the 5th anniversary of the Final Release ten days ago our own way by delivering a whole release train:

  • Money API 1.1
  • JavaMoney Parent 1.1
  • Moneta 1.4
  • TCK 1.1
  • JavaMoney Library 1.1
Check the issues resolved by the MR1 API and RI on GitHub.

While they are not parts of the actual JSR, the backports:

  • API BP 1.0.4
  • Moneta BP 1.4
also got updates.

To the next 5, 10 or 25 years of Java and JavaMoney.

item.title: JSR 354 Final 5th Anniversary
item.description:
5th Anniversary of the Final Release

JSR 354 Final 5th Anniversary

Today marks the fifth anniversary of the JSR 354 Final Release.
The same year, Java will be turning 25 precisely 10 days from now.
After The Maintenance Release 1 of JSR 354 was code complete on Star Wars Day we expect to submit the MR1 to the JCP in the next couple of days.

item.title: May the 354th be with You
item.description:
MR 1 Code Complete

Maintenance Release Code Complete on Star Wars Day

Today the Maintenance Release 1 of JSR 354 was tagged code complete on Star Wars Day.
Check the issues resolved by MR1 on GitHub.
We still have to clarify a few things like the PGP keys to use for Sonatype/MavenCentral, but within a couple of days we should also have them on Sonatype Nexus after we deployed them on Bintray.

Thanks everyone who made this possible.

item.title: DevoXX BE 2019
item.description:
DevoXX BE 2019

JSR 354 at Tools-in-Action session of Devoxx BE 2019

Werner held a Tools-in-Action session about JSR 354 on the first day of DevoXX BE 2019.

item.title: JCON 2019
item.description:
JCON 2019

JSR 354 at JCON 2019

Werner and Anatole held a session about JSR 354 on the last day of JCON 2019.

item.title: Transfer Ballot
item.description:
Maintenance Lead Transfer

Transfer Ballot

Today the Maintenance Lead Transfer Ballot for JSR 354 was unanimously approved by the JCP EC. Check out the results.
We (the 3 Maintenance Leads approved by the ballot) plan to post a Maintenance Release 1 of JSR 354 (which will also be reviewed and voted on by the EC) before the end of the year. Once the JCP EC Elections are over and the new or returning EC members resume duty.
Check the issues targeted for MR1 on GitHub and please let us know, if you feel anything you face could be missing.

Thanks everyone in the JCP EC, the PMO and Credit Suisse for allowing further progress of JSR 354 and the wider JavaMoney project.

item.title: Moneta Release 1.3
item.description:
Release 1.3

RI Release 1.3

Friday the 13th happened again this year in July. And another Service Release of the JSR 354 RI was released today.
Partly because enough issues were fixed, partly because it's a nice date, especially for a release 1.3 ;-)
Fixing some issues, for a complete list see 1.3 Milestone for further details. And check the release tag 1.3 in the GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped with this release.

item.title: PSD2 XS2A
item.description:
PSD2

XS2A

To support the EU directive PSD2 the Berlin Group initiative described and specified the process to implement PSD2 in an open and transparent manner.

Adorsys, a development consultancy specialized in the financial and insurance sector made an XS2A blueprint and Java reference implementation of the Berlin Group specification available on GitHub. We created a fork at JavaMoney and contributed some improvements back to the upstream repository by Adorsys via PRs.

item.title: API Release 1.0.3
item.description:
Service Release 3

API Release 1.0.3

A new service release of JSR 354 API was released today.
The major improvement was embracing the Java 9 module system. As usual This patch release 1.0.3 of JSR 354 was be made available on popular Maven repositories.
There are no structural API changes nor JavaDoc, etc. therefore no MR was necessary for this and jcp.org won't be updated. Check the 1.0.3 release tag.

Thanks everyone who helped publish this release.

item.title: Moneta Release 1.2
item.description:
Release 1.2

RI Release 1.2

Friday the 13th was a lucky day this year. A Service Release of the JSR 354 RI was released today.
Fixing some issues, for a complete list see 1.2 Milestone for further details. And check the release tag 1.2 in the GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped publish this release.

item.title: API Release 1.0.2
item.description:
Service Release 2

API Release 1.0.2

A new service release of JSR 354 API was released today.
The major improvement was embracing the Java 9 module system. As usual This patch release 1.0.2 of JSR 354 was be made available on popular Maven repositories.
There are no structural API changes nor JavaDoc, etc. therefore no MR was necessary for this and jcp.org won't be updated. Check the 1.0.2 release tag.

Thanks everyone who helped publish this release.

item.title: Moneta Release 1.1
item.description:
Service Release

RI Release 1.1

A Service Release of the JSR 354 RIs was released today.
Fixing a few issues, e.g. differences between Moneta and Moneta-BP. See Github issue tracker for further details. And check the MavenCentral status badge in the JSR 354 RI GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped publish this release.

item.title: CloJUG April 2016
item.description:
Alexis Lopez - JSR354: Currency and Money

Alexis Lopez gave a live presentation to the Cali Java Users Group.

This presentation is recorded to satisfy the JavaOne CFP submission requirement. It has been already delivered to the Cali Java Users Group in Spanish.

item.title: API Release 1.0.1
item.description:
Patch Release

API Release 1.0.1

A small patch of JSR 354 API was released yesterday.
The major fix was building the Java 7 (BP) API with Java 7 instead of Java 8. To ensure there are no class version compatibility problems running API-BP and Moneta-BP under Java 7. This patch release 1.0.1 of JSR 354 was be made available on popular Maven repositories.
There are no structural API changes nor JavaDoc, etc. therefore no MR was necessary for this and jcp.org won't be updated. Check the MavenCentral status badge in the JSR 354 API GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped publish this release.

item.title: Final Release
item.description:
Final Release

Final Release

JSR 354 just passed Final Approval Ballot by the JCP EC. Check out the results.
Final Release 1.0 of JSR 354 will be made available soon on jcp.org as well as popular Maven repositories.
Check for it e.g. via MavenCentral status badge in the JSR 354 API GitHub repository.

Thanks everyone who helped with JSR 354 and the wider JavaMoney project.

item.title: Star Spec Lead
item.description:
Star Spec Lead 2014

The JCP program recognized JSR 354 Spec Lead Anatole Tresch as 2014 Star Spec Lead.
Congratulations Anatole and thanks for your great work on JSR 354.

item.description:

The JSR 354 Proposed Final Draft started on JCP.org. Check out the PFD Download Page

item.title: JavaOne 2014
item.description:
JavaOne 2014

JSR 354 at Hackergarten

Anatole hosted a Hackergarten session on JSR 354 at JavaOne 2014.

Bitcoin Panel about JavaMoney

Two leading JavaMoney contributors (though Anatole must have caught a bit too much "Java Feaver" in the Hackergarten it seems;-) and Payward COO Micchael Gronager were on an expert panel on Java and Digital Currencies, Friend or Foe? at JavaOne 2014.

JavaMoney Shelter

Shelter Opened

The JavaMoney Shelter opened for incubating modules and those in need of adoption.
Check out javamoney-shelter to Adopt-a-JSR and related projects before Christmas;-)
